Instance.description: Represents tuning for a role state. Deferring Instance Tunable declaration because of circular reference that can occur with defining the role state transition snippet and declaration of the field in the instance tunables

Tunable.name: _allow_npc_routing_on_active_lot
Tunable.display: Allow Npc Routing On Active Lot
Tunable.description:
If True, then npc in this role will be allowed to route on the active lot. If False, then npc in this role will not be allowed to route on the active lot, unless they are already on the lot when the role state is activated.
This flag is ignored for player sims and npcs who live on the active lot.
e.g. ambient walkby sims should not be routing on the active lot because that is rude.

TunableVariant.name: _autonomy_state_override
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will force role sims into a specific autonomy state. Please consult your GPE partner before using this.

TunableList.name: _buffs
TunableList.description: Buffs that will be added to sim when role is active.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableEnum.name: _crafting_process_override
TunableEnum.description: The override option of who to assign ownership of objects made by Sims in this role state.

TunableTuple.name: _off_lot_autonomy_buff
TunableTuple.description:
A buff that prevents autonomy from considering some objects based on the location of the object (e.g. on lot, off lot, within a radius of the sim).
In the buff set: Game Effect Modifiers->Autonomy Modifier->Off Lot Autonomy Rule.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: _on_activate
TunableVariant.description: Select the autonomy behavior when this role state becomes active on the sim. disabled: Take no action. autonomy_ping: We explicitly force an autonomy ping on the sim. push_affordance: Push the specific affordance on the sim.

TunableTuple.name: parameterized_autonomy_ping
TunableTuple.description: Parameterized autonomy ping to run either during preroll or as soon as the sim is assigned this role.

TunableList.name: commodities
TunableList.description: Set of commodities to run parameterized autonomy against after running this interaction.

Tunable.description: The type of commodity to search for.

Tunable.name: consider_scores_of_zero
Tunable.description: The autonomy request will consider scores of zero. This allows sims to to choose things they might not desire.

TunableVariant.name: full_ping_on_fail
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, if the parameterized ping fails to find an interaction it will do a full autonomy ping after the specified delay.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A duration that may be specified in weeks/days/hours/minutes.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableVariant.name: off_lot_rule
TunableVariant.description:
The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets.
DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets.
DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems.

TunableTuple.name: anchored
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_buff
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all sims that match the tuned buff.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all objects that match the tuned tag.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to find an object to be an anchor.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description:
The radius around the anchoring point in which the sim will consider objects. This point must be set on the autonomy component.
Designers: Please make sure this autonomy modifier is attached to a role or other other gameplay system that will correctly set the anchoring point before you set this. Or set the anchor tag on this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: default_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

Tunable.name: tolerance
Tunable.description: This is how many meters the Sim can be off of the lot while still being considered on the lot for the purposes of autonomy. For example, if this is set to 5, the sim can be 5 meters from the edge of the lot and still consider all the objects on the lot for autonomy. If the sim were to step 6 meters from the lot, the sim would be considered off the lot and would only score off-lot objects that are within the off lot radius.

TunableTuple.name: off_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

TunableTuple.name: on_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot.

TunableTuple.name: restricted
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects in the restricted open street autonomy area. This is defined by points in world builder so please make sure that world builder has setup the objects before trying to use this option.

TunableTuple.name: unlimited
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority level at which this autonomy will run.

Tunable.name: radius_to_consider
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim that targets must be in to be valid for Parameterized Autonomy. Anything outside this radius will be ignored. A radius of 0 is considered infinite.

TunableVariant.name: run_priority
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the run priority at which the selected affordance (if any is selected) will run.

TunableEnum.name: source
TunableEnum.description: Set this to *spoof* the source of this interaction. This will have various gameplay effects and should be used after due consideration.

TunableList.name: static_commodities
TunableList.description: Set of static commodities to run parameterized autonomy against after running this interaction.

Tunable.description: The type of static commodity to search for.

Tunable.name: test_connectivity_to_target
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will ensure the Sim can pass a pt to pt connectivity check to the advertising object.

TunableTuple.name: push_affordance
TunableTuple.description: Push the specific affordance onto the sim.

Tunable.name: add_situation_liability
Tunable.description: If set to True, we will add a liability to the pushed interaction such that we will cancel the situation owning this role state if the interaction (and its continuations) are completed or canceled.

Tunable.name: cancel_interaction_on_leave_role
Tunable.description: If set to True, we will cancel the interaction (and continuations) when the sim leaves the role.

Tunable.name: leave_situation_on_failure
Tunable.description: If set to True, when push affordance on the sim fails, sim will leave the situation.

TunableEnum.name: run_priority
TunableEnum.description: Priority to run the interaction. None means use the (push) priority

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_for_mixer
TunableVariant.description: If we want to push mixer directly in the affordance tuning for this role state, we would need to provide a super affordance here to handle the mixer.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target of the affordance. We will try to get the target from the situation the role sim is running.

TunableList.name: _portal_disallowance_tags
TunableList.description: A set of tags that define what the portal disallowance tags of this role state are. Portals that include any of these disallowance tags are considered locked for sims that have this role state.

TunableEnum.name: _role_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this role state. All the role states with the same priority will all be applied together. The highest group of priorities is considered the active ones.

Tunable.name: always_active
Tunable.description:
If set to True, this role will always be allowed to be active when set on a Sim, regardless of whether or not it is lower priority than the Sim's other currently active roles. Use for roles that are important but retuning priority for it and/or other roles isn't feasible.
Consult a GPE before you set this to True. This is not to be used lightly and there may be other options like situation exclusivity that can be explored before you go down this route.
e.g. Sim is possessed which runs at HIGH priority. Sim wants to go visit an NPC residential lot, which places Sim in NORMAL priority Role_UngreetedPlayerVisitingNPC, which sets portal disallowance and adds specific buffs.
We actually want Role_UngreetedPlayerVisitingNPC to run even though the role priority is now HIGH, because otherwise a possessed Sim visiting an NPC would magically be able to route through homes because portal disallowance is removed.

TunableList.name: loot_on_load
TunableList.description: A list of loots that will be applied if a sim is in this role state during zone spin up.

TunableList.name: preroll_affordances
TunableList.description:
A list of affordances that are available for sims to consider when running pre-roll. Objects related to role can specify preroll autonomy, but there are some roles that may not have an object associated with it
e.g. Romance guru in romance festival preroll to an attractor point.

TunableList.name: role_affordances
TunableList.description:
A list of affordances that are available on the Sim in this Role State.
e.g: when a Maid is in the working Role State, he or she will have the 'Dismiss' and 'Fire' affordances available in the Pie Menu.

TunableList.name: role_target_affordances
TunableList.description:
A list of affordances that are available on other Sims when the actor Sim is in this Role State.
e.g. a Sim in a specific Role State could have an "Invite to Situation" interaction available when bringing up other Sims' Pie Menus.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: Tags for the role state for checking role states against a set of tags rather than against a list of role states.
